website_summaries.verdict: With Asus' slickest user interface yet, included keyboard, and a competitive starting price, the small but chunky Transformer Pad TF103 is an attractively affordable tablet hybrid.
pros: The Asus Transformer TF103 ships with a keyboard dock, Asus' slick, feature-filled Zen user interface, and useful preloaded apps
Its $299 starting price is low for a tablet hybrid
cons: The plastic construction of the keyboard feels cheap, the trackpad response sometimes lags, and its thick-bezeled, girthy design is outdated

website_summaries.verdict: With an included keyboard dock, the Asus Transformer Pad TF103C will appeal to productivity hounds on a budget, but it's an otherwise unimpressive Android tablet.

customer_reviews.title: I'll fix it at some point but so far so good! She's seen the occasional drop but none the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little beauty about a year ago to be my primary 'work' computer. It has traveled quite a bit with me and has held up well. One of the kids kicked the screen when it was on the floor of my car in a bag so I have two big cracks in the screen. It hasn't caused one issue yet. I'll fix it at some point but so far so good! She's seen the occasional drop but none the worse for wear. Works great. I don't use many of the native apps but everything I use regularly is flawless. I would buy again, fo sho.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely TERRIFIC purchase! Daughter had the time now to fully ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely TERRIFIC purchase! Daughter had the time now to fully break the tablet in and truly loves it. She has been able to download all of her favorite apps and enjoys making our internet provider cringe at the bandwidth she goes through. Battery life is great, screen crystal clear, and speakers provide rich and ample sound for a tablet. I would recommend pairing it with a decent set of speakers if you want to stream movies and such, but overall a great piece of hardware at a fantastic price point.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N.

customer_reviews.title: Overall, Really happy.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm really happy with this tablet. My windows laptop died again and the TF103 has become my main computer now and I no longer have any Windows machines in my house. The keyboard is nice and turns the tablet into a nice laptop. While it is definitely a budget machine, the only place I really notice that is in the small internal storage. This wouldn't be a problem except for the way KitKat now handles app storage. I've managed to work around this as only a minor inconvenience. I would like to not have the bloatware but I don't think many Android tablets are bloatware-free.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tablet!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second of the Asus Transformer tablets I've bought. The first is in use by my ex, so I bought one for myself based on my previous experience. I love the detachable keyboard that gives this functional and easy to use tablet a more laptop-like feel. The micro SD slot is great for boosting storage, and I also like having the USB port. Quite simply, this is a great Android tablet. The graphics and video quality are wonderful, and everything is fast and responsive. It's more expensive than some other tablets, but worth the price by far.
customer_reviews.author: J. HolstTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: ASUS is one of my favorite computer companies
customer_reviews.text: ASUS is one of my favorite computer companies. I wanted something small with a keyboard to take to class, but I also wanted the portability of a tablet. This filled both those needs. Just some minor inconveniences to note: -Keyboard sometimes will stop being detected by the tablet. Just detach the tablet and reattach to the keyboard and it should get detected again. -battery life is poop. Kinda expected though since it's a huge tablet powering a huge screen. I'm never far from a charger though so it's just a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Good for my purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a relative who knows nothing about computers, and certainly not tablets. So far, so good! I've tried it out and seems pretty sturdy and reliable. The keyboard works well, no problems, but since he's not an experienced user there's no assessment if it's better/worse than another. My main reason for purchasing was the relatively low-cost, good features, integrated keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: TrolleyTicket

customer_reviews.title: I bought this in Sept. 2014 and had trouble ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Sept. 2014 and had trouble from day one. Should have returned it but assume it was software or my fault I was just using it for simple office notes so I wouldn't have to drag my laptop back and forth to the office. I have done 2 factory resets and it always came back. I just didn't want to go through returning and doing without my tablet at work. NOW, it is dead. Won't charge, won't turn on...just the black screen of death. Do not buy this tablet!!! I'm begiinning to wonder if it's counterfeit. Now I have to contact the manufacturer anyway because it should be under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: D. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy! Nothing but problems with the detachable keyboard, and battery. Apparently, there's a chip in the keyboard that keeps draining the battery in the tablet. Returned it several times for factory service. They just keep replacing the battery, which isn't the problem. It turns out that this is a well documented issue online. Asus will not acknowledge or fix the problem. They say to use the tablet without the keyboard. What? Why do you think I bought it in the first place!!! This tablet is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nekton

customer_reviews.title: I will not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: It has been six months since I placed the order for two of these tablets and since then I have had to have one replaced because it would not start-up, the logo screen would come on and then it would cycle back down and then back to the logo screen again I think it is referred to as a start up loop. And now the other tablet will not charge, it doesn’t even turn on with the cable attached. I have used both chargers and they will charge one but not the other. So two tablets, six months and both need to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall good tablet for a kid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet for my 7 year old. She wanted a laptop with a keyboard because she's learning to type at school, but she also really wants to play apps from googleplay. This tablet is just right for her. The keyboard is nice and the screen is responsive. My only complaint would be that it is kinda difficult to open up. Doesn't seem like there's a good place to insert your finger, but I don't mess with it much and my daughter doesn't seem to have any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good if you realize it's not a fast processor before you but.
customer_reviews.text: I is NOT a fast processor so KNOW this before you buy - you WILL SEE DELAYS in start up, etc. On the other hand - for so little money it is great. Once programs load (most right away) it is fast, and doe what it advertises. I've given it 5 stars not because it is as good as tablets twice the price (it is not) but it is MUCH better than other tablets at the same price. DON'T buy this if you demand instant load of programs, moving around menu, etc.
customer_reviews.author: David Stewart

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! The form factor is small and the keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: I am speaking as a parent who purchased two of these for my kids. These are awesome! The form factor is small and the keyboard fits the size of my kids. They are able to still learn old fundamental typing skills while having the capability of a touch screen tablet. My only con would be that the touch pad seems slightly unresponsive (for me) at times but my kids have no issue with it. Maybe it is me that is causing a user error *shrug*. Overall, great product!
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Love it and would recomend to friends
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tablet. its fast and easy to use. Its bigger then you think and it the perfect size even with the case on and the keyboard on, to fit in your bag or purse. it does take awhile to charge so overnight charger routine is your best bet. and it will last awhile once fully charged. I stream movies, play music and multi-task on it and it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the casual user
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet for the casual user. The keyboard is a bit too small and the mouse pad a bit too finicky for serious productivity. That was expected from the size and the OS, respectively. When using the mouse pad, hovering over an item is treated as a long press. But since this is an Android device the touchscreen is a better input anyway. I have already recommended the device to friends and family looking for athe casual tablet experience. I would not buy this for work or school. A full laptop would be more suited for heavy productivity.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: ... but either way thats 2 out of 3 items bad
customer_reviews.text: this item was sent with out the key board and i made sure it says that it is included how ever it dose not matter the unit will not charge not sure if its the wire or the tablet but either way thats 2 out of 3 items bad lol
customer_reviews.author: ethereal

customer_reviews.title: ... old mother to use and we are both very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I got this tablet for my 83-year old mother to use and we are both very happy with it. She finds that using a stylus to type helps a lot but other than that the tablet is working out fine for her. The screen is large and clear enough for her to see even without her glasses and it is very easy to charge and use. I recommend this tablet if you are looking for a good, solid, larger-screen tablet for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Dongu

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: wasn't fast enough for what i needed. transferring items to the machine was a hassle and it never seemed to go into standby so the battery died frequently. pandora kept crashing when i flipped it over to do some readying/browsing. I uninstalled it and reinstalled without luck. tried updating the OS, but that didn't help either. Ended up returning it for the touchscreen issues I was having.
customer_reviews.author: Fredo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It works so much better than any iOS I have tried and it works so smoothly. my only problem with this combo is the keyboard. The mouse pad is supper sensitive, I can barly brush it and it will start clicking on things.
customer_reviews.author: RommyBlake

customer_reviews.title: Disppointed.  Had to replace.
customer_reviews.text: The specs and performance are fine, but the tablet has become nearly unusable because it spontaneously and randomly reboots several times an hour. I have tried all of the solutions in ASUS forums but the problem has persisted and only gotten worse. The problem is apparently common. I replaced with a Samsung Galaxy Tab A, 9.7.
customer_reviews.author: L. Van

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tablet and loved it while it lasted. About a month after having it, it completely blacked out. Wouldn't turn on, wouldn't charge. Totally dead. I kept it in perfect condition, always in a case. There was never any damage done to it. I am assuming there was a defect in this particular tablet because we read the reviews before purchasing and they were pretty good. But I can say I would never buy this product again. We returned it and spent the extra money on a Samsung Tab S.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent tablet/convertable for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product for what I use it for. It's a neat portable companion that allows me to get some quick work done such as word processing and the like. The tablet part of the bundle is a decent android tablet powered by Kitkat version 4.4.2 which is good enough for me. Batter life can be better and an update to 5.0 Lollipop would give this a 5 star rating. However, for what you are getting for the money, it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: do that and hope for the best. Otherwise
customer_reviews.text: This tablet worked well for about a year, then I started to have problems with the screen not detecting touch. Turns out that it is a very common problem that can start up as soon as 3 days after receiving the item. There are a number of "fixes" for it, but if you are able to use the warranty, do that and hope for the best. Otherwise, you may just have to always use it plugged into the dock and use the pointer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An Asus success.
customer_reviews.text: Another great Asus product. I already had the tf-100 which is excellent. This newer model is nearly as good. This one lacks the back up battery in the keyboard which is a plus for the tf-100. They can occasionally run slower than desired but are still snappy and any lag is cut down with the addition of Memory Booster Full app for android. A minor cost which makes for a great machine. This can very nearly replace a Laptop if done correctly.
customer_reviews.author: ZDad

customer_reviews.title: So far I could not be happier with this tablet
customer_reviews.text: So far I could not be happier with this tablet! It doesn't have the best of cameras in it, but I also didn't buy it to be a photographer either! If you are looking for a good tablet but do not want to spend a fortune, this is definitely the tablet to get!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe N

customer_reviews.title: Garbage pile.
customer_reviews.text: Two years in and the touchscreen doesn't work. Asus estimates the repair costs at $200. I paid $258 so that doesn't seem like a great offer. Total garbage pile and I'll never buy one of their products again.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Shopper

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Transformer Pad TF103C-A1-Bundle 10.1-Inch - Do not sit on this tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Very fragile. After crushing 4 (really!), switched to a Samsung S 10 Tab. No more problems. If you want to stay with Asus, maybe the 700 with the aluminum frame might be a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Troglodite

customer_reviews.title: I love this little thing too bad it was o buggy ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing too bad it was o buggy it was great to use I might even purchase another
customer_reviews.author: blakrepublic

customer_reviews.title: Thinking of buying - DON'T!!!
customer_reviews.text: most frustrating piece of tech that I've purchased in quite a while. Touchscreen does not work. Beautiful graphics; crappy sound card. I would give this tablet away except I know the person would think I hated them!
customer_reviews.author: Luxor

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my brother for Christmas and he says he really likes it. Doesn't support all programs he uses but he says it does the main thing. He is thoroughly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley face

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this tablet and chose next day shipping. Receive ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this tablet and chose next day shipping. Receive the next day and let charge TEN hours. It will not turn on... I've looked up every way I can turn it on, reset reboot. I don't think it's even charging because I don't see any kind of charge light. Be careful when ordering a refurbished one, I had to order the brand new one and will be returning the defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Aside form that this tablet could easily replace a Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Faster than My tablet. Only Down side... The Asus Architecture does not allow you to move Apps to the SD to run them from there to save resident memory. Aside form that this tablet could easily replace a Laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Rarewein

customer_reviews.title: Geek Squad at Best buys could not get it to work either
customer_reviews.text: It stopped coming on after a few weeks, still withing the three month warranty period. Neither Amazon nor Asus support have replaced it and there is only one week to go before warranty expires. Geek Squad at Best buys could not get it to work either..
customer_reviews.author: Tom Branum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our Daughter
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for our daughter (11). She has been unalbe to put it down. Cat videos! Smooth tranistions and great speed on programs. Worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: OK. The docking keyboard is great in theory but somehow it locks the screen up all the time and the touchpad freezes as well. I hope there is an update that will fix this.
customer_reviews.author: sasquatch606

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: The touchscreen often doesn't work. I've already sent this to Asus twice for repair, and it has broken again already, just 14 months into purchasing it. DON'T BUY IT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: RJL

customer_reviews.title: only slightly better than a chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest, not the most intuitive, and really doesn't get updated much. it's nice having the fullsize USB availible for other devices, but the screen resolution is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Knightslugger

customer_reviews.title: Keys too touchy and pad too sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: Had over a year... generally like the unit. Pros: has not crashed, Great screen. Cons: Keys too small and way to sensitive! No adjustment for folks with fat fingers!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't even last a year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about 10 months ago for my 11th grade daughter to use at school. The power switch no longer works, very difficult to now power it on or off. Its like it has some sort of short. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JahJones

customer_reviews.title: Useless after one year
customer_reviews.text: After a little over a year, the touch screen stopped working altogether, although I can still use the keyboard on the device. Over the past few months it has become increasingly slow to load pages and was taking nearly an entire day to recharge. The battery would run down in less than 2 hours while listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POS alert
customer_reviews.text: Touch screen stopped working after a month. Restarting used to help, but now it's just an android mini laptop. The mouse pointer has also been acting up.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: ASUS does it again! I bought my first ASUS transformer about 4 years ago, but didn't get the keyboard at that time. This tablet 2-in-1 is great. Can surf online, write notes, watch movies, everything you want from a laptop, but with the touch screen it makes moving around so much easier. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be any happier purchasing this Asus Transformer
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be any happier purchasing this Asus Transformer. Ever since I got it, I am on my laptop less and less because of it and there are still so many things I can do with it but haven't had the time yet.
customer_reviews.author: James E Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, wasted money, ended up buying a Galaxy Tab 4
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very satisfied with this purchase: - The keyboard is counter-intuitive with an extremely small shift key that is quite frustrating - It runs an ASUS version of Android that is very bloated and slow - It bricked after about of month of use. Now it rarely boots properly, crashes often, and is frequently stuck in a boot loop.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Slow as molasses and the swing arc is limited. Samsung have proven to be much better
customer_reviews.author: OVERWATCH

customer_reviews.title: I tried the cool on stuff but it doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: What do i need to do for fix my tablet. I bought it 6 months ago and know it stays freeze in the main screen it say ASUS. I tried the cool on stuff but it doesnt work. I need mi tablet back or my money back. patricioyepez_c@hotmail. com
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: Ok tablet
customer_reviews.text: Not much power, touch display is lacking, battery is bad, apps run ok. Overall disappointed with my purchase. I was expecting much more from this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: phillip bell

customer_reviews.title: it's a great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a while now and my main issue is that the touch screen keeps not working. I have to completely factory reset the tablet every time it stops working. Other than that, it's a great tablet!
customer_reviews.author: l. seale

customer_reviews.title: nice tablet - great price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tablet, had gotten 1 from a computer store without a keypad and saw one on amazon with a keypad for not much more so i ordered one for my wife and took the keypad for myself. We can share when necessary fits both tablets easily.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A

customer_reviews.title: terrible lagging performnace
customer_reviews.text: terrible lagging performnace, mu old asus tablet out perfomrs this one by miles, kept freezing and not performing never will buy asus again, sent another one back that came dead on arrival
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Mokotoff

customer_reviews.title: Faster than my Galaxy S5!
customer_reviews.text: Great android tablet and net book! Faster than my Galaxy S5! I use it more at home than my Windows 8 laptop w/an i7 processor!
customer_reviews.author: M. Froehlich

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and fair priced product
customer_reviews.text: Very fast, sleek design, excellent package for the price, easy to use, lots of perks, perform well thus far. Love the keyboard docking feature, good quality video , smooth response, handy with good quality sound, fair price. Strongly recommended am very satisfied si far. Thanks for well designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Battery Issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband 6 months ago. Battery goes dead every time it is taken off the charger. Charger cord broke soon after purchasing and no other cords are interchangeable. Very disppointed based on the reviews I read prior to purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: probably i got a bad product but this give trouble from day one and ...
customer_reviews.text: probably i got a bad product but this give trouble from day one and i am a asus product fan.
customer_reviews.author: timmaz dang3rus

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i love this asus pad as quality .also, with keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Togo

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop, err,  TABLET I mean.
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised at how well this tablet works. Works as good as a laptop computer. I am very pleased with everything on this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Carnicom

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited when I received this,it was an early birthday present. It arrived in perfect condition and the shipping was fast. After 3 weeks I had to return it because the laptop would not charge pass 75% and lost a charge quickly. I really wanted to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great as a productivity tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very fast and user friendly. Great as a productivity tablet. My wife users it all the time for Word projects. Excellent. Excellent company as well ASUS isn't obtuse!
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I like ASUS a lot. I always use their motherboards in all my computer builds. I figured their tablet would be good, but I was wrong. It was slow from the start, not impressed with the hardware. The tablet stopped working after 6 months. It just keeps showing "ASUS In search of incredible' and rebooting. I cannot get into recovery(pwr + vol down) to even repair. I did NOT try to flash any roms or anything, maybe I just had bad luck with this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Broke after less than a couple of months, screen broke after less than a year. Warranty was not honored.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Martin

customer_reviews.title: Battery life isn't great. When you're using it it's just more of ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery life isn't great. When you're using it it's just more of a pain than it's worth . About something else this year or something like that
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Screen crashes
customer_reviews.text: After about two weeks it worked well, the screen stopped working when running games in high resolution. It happened several times in that week. Finally, the screen stopped working at all. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio L.

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed.....
customer_reviews.text: It died right after the warranty very disappointed in this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Lover

customer_reviews.title: A lot of bloatware
customer_reviews.text: A lot of bloatware. Screen flickers at low settings, can't move apps to external memory chip and generally unstable even after update. However has good size fonts for Kindle reader. Update: after recent update some apps are movable to chip.
customer_reviews.author: Catch the Moment

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what it was designed to do... replace a notebook for Internet and Standard Apps
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our college age niece. It will be her "PC" She uses Facebook, web, movies and writes for school and personal projects. None of that needs a full windows machine. This is not a super light or thin tablet. The cameras are passable. But it is fast and the screen is bright and sharp enough. There are better tablets for $300-500. but if you want a machine that can replace most PC uses, this is great. The connection to keyboard is very good. The keyboard is heavy to keep it upright. My niece was up and running on her writing in 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ken in WA

customer_reviews.title: Like any ASUS product I have ever gotten it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Like any ASUS product I have ever gotten it is reliable and worth the price. The docking part is a little cheap but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: claudio ieronimo

customer_reviews.title: A great prouduct. However the battery runs down to quickly ...
customer_reviews.text: A great prouduct . However the battery runs down to quickly even when it was fully charged according to the instructions that came with it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carla Jordan-Butler

customer_reviews.title: It up and quit on us. Won't turn on ...
customer_reviews.text: It up and quit on us. Won't turn on or charge. Not used very much and never dropped or damaged. I regret buying 2 of them. Now I am waiting for the second one to quit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet with Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love the portability, runs a little slow but expected that with only 1gb of ram. It's not a mini laptop pc, but I like the size and portability. Great for taking notes or browsing while on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Martens

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is the battery. it can on;y survive for about 90 mins
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Chiang

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is. Speakers are kinda bad though
customer_reviews.text: It's good for when you need a computer for work. Speakers are very bad, especially after last software update
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: very quick and light I recommend the Asus and seller
customer_reviews.text: Very unit, very quick and light I recommend the Asus and seller!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Savala

customer_reviews.title: i use this pad everyday love it love it love it
customer_reviews.text: i use this pad everyday love it love it love it, i don't leave home without this unit in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron F.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: had to have it replaced but the new one wrks fiine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: password lock on "new" tablet
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the product, it came in perfect condition but had a password protection on it, could not factory reset it and was very dissapoinyed in the "new" product being password protected, clearly used then reset but didn't do it right.very dissapointed in this purchase !
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Woods

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS TABLET!!!!
customer_reviews.text: awesome transformer tablet! keyboard is easy and wonderful to work on. Not awful heavy either. clear screen and gorgous colour. i watch hulu on it all the time and it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Transformers: More Than Meets the Eye
customer_reviews.text: Really nice to have a dedicated keyboard that isn't a "generic" bluetooth keyboard. Truly feels like a laptop when I want one with all the benefits of a tablet when I don't. I really like the screen-cast feature when paired with my chromecast.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Pell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tablet, the battery life is good, and the keyboard dock adds a lot of functionality to it. The processor is a tad on the slow side, memory is a little bit small, but I normally don't notice it. The only time it comes into play is playing some HD movies. For the price it can't be beat, I do kind of wish it also had a built in stylus like the Samsung Note, but I just want it all.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Unresponsive touch screen - three times
customer_reviews.text: I've had to send it back to ASUS twice to repair the unresponsive touch screen. It is now unresponsive yet again....ended up buying a new tablet. It did last a little while in between repairs. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Hare

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different brand!
customer_reviews.text: Only worked right for a month, to long for Amazon to take it back. The keyboard would not work.
customer_reviews.author: JDollar5

customer_reviews.title: seems perfectly good - just my learning curve
customer_reviews.text: Difficult for ME to transition to touch screen because I've never used it before. As far as product, seems perfectly good - just my learning curve. Need to include better manual(s) as small ones included don't include adequate info.
customer_reviews.author: kadyesse

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality.
customer_reviews.text: The touchscreen of the tablet stopped working 6 months after I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Delboy

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased as a gift and the recipient is very satisfied. My only gripe is that you cannot move ...
customer_reviews.text: Was purchased as a gift and the recipient is very satisfied. My only gripe is that you cannot move apps to sd card . Other than that seems to be a excellent device.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Robert Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: The screen sometime won't work when u touch it, ...
customer_reviews.text: The screen sometime won't work when u touch it, u have press it hard or over and over to get to work.
customer_reviews.author: simz

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy :(
customer_reviews.text: From the day I opened my package the camera didn't work and it only chargers with the exact charger it came with... Even though it's a universal port. I lost that charger and now I can't use my tablet...very upset and unsatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kate Nye

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice tablet but the battery drains fast if its connected to its keyboard

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, bad design.
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these, and the buttons stuck on both. Returned both of them.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Freezes constantly try a different tablet I switched to a samsung galaxy
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My tablet stopped responding to touch 7 months after I bought it. The only way I can use the device is if it's connected to the keyboard dock. I am really disappointed with this purchase and would not recommend it as a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: This tablet turned out great for me
customer_reviews.text: This tablet turned out great for me. It may be a little slow sometimes, but at the price I do not think you can beat this tablet. I was very pleased with the product and arrival time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but no Lollipop
customer_reviews.text: This works great and the USB port is nice because I can use my MIDI keyboard controller with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ving B Junior

customer_reviews.title: These were for my Grankids and they love them. They took a trip after they got ...
customer_reviews.text: These were for my Grankids and they love them. They took a trip after they got them and my daughter said that was the quitest trip they ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is the best tablet I have used. It will probbably replace my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In addition it was an excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: a bit clunky at times, but over all it met or exeeded all my expectations. In addition it was an excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Fourman

customer_reviews.title: Like it EXCEPT...
customer_reviews.text: I'm liking the Transformer tablet. My only issue with it so far is that it sometimes freezes on the ASUS screen when I open it up. I have to force it to "reboot" by holding down the up-volume switch and the power switch simultaneously. It will then go through its normal start-up procedure. Other than that one issue, I'm very pleased with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Pakrat

customer_reviews.title: it is an ok tablet. not great
customer_reviews.text: Not quite what I expected. I wanted to be able to use my magic jack with it but I cannot.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product. Nice picture and sound . It needs a HDMI port.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: they are very pleased and seem to be navigating them fine
customer_reviews.text: They were Christmas presents for my two granddaughters, ages 11 & 12. So far, they are very pleased and seem to be navigating them fine.
customer_reviews.author: V  James Davis

customer_reviews.title: The build quality is decent but the performance is simply ...
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is decent but the performance is simply abysmal. The entire tablet is just sluggish, no matter what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Replacing my broken one. Cheaper to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Clinesmih

customer_reviews.title: It seems to work great so far
customer_reviews.text: Clear screen and becomes a tablet flawlessly. I have not used it for much more than surfing and emails. It seems to work great so far.
